HP:0000002.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Growth abnormality (HP:0001507) -> Abnormality of body height (HP:0000002)
HP:0000002.definition: Deviation from the norm of height with respect to that which is expected according to age and gender norms.

HP:0000003.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal morphology (HP:0012210) -> Renal cyst (HP:0000107) -> Multicystic kidney dysplasia (HP:0000003)
HP:0000003.definition: Multicystic dysplasia of the kidney is characterized by multiple cysts of varying size in the kidney and the absence of a normal pelvicaliceal system. The condition is associated with ureteral or ureteropelvic atresia, and the affected kidney is nonfunctional.

HP:0000005.definition: The pattern in which a particular genetic trait or disorder is passed from one generation to the next.

HP:0000006.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Mode of inheritance (HP:0000005) -> Mendelian inheritance (HP:0034345) -> Autosomal dominant inheritance (HP:0000006)
HP:0000006.definition: A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on one of the autosomes (i.e., the human chromosomes 1-22) in which a trait manifests in heterozygotes. In the context of medical genetics, an autosomal dominant disorder is caused when a single copy of the mutant allele is present. Males and females are affected equally, and can both transmit the disorder with a risk of 50% for each child of inheriting the mutant allele.

HP:0000007.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Mode of inheritance (HP:0000005) -> Mendelian inheritance (HP:0034345) -> Autosomal recessive inheritance (HP:0000007)
HP:0000007.definition: A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on one of the autosomes (i.e., the human chromosomes 1-22) in which a trait manifests in individuals with two pathogenic alleles, either homozygotes (two copies of the same mutant allele) or compound heterozygotes (whereby each copy of a gene has a distinct mutant allele).

HP:0000008.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal internal genitalia (HP:0000812) -> Abnormal morphology of female internal genitalia (HP:0000008)
HP:0000008.definition: An abnormality of the female internal genitalia.

HP:0000009.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the lower urinary tract (HP:0010936) -> Abnormality of the bladder (HP:0000014) -> Functional abnormality of the bladder (HP:0000009)

HP:0000010.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the immune system (HP:0002715) -> Abnormality of immune system physiology (HP:0010978) -> Unusual infection (HP:0032101) -> Recurrent infections (HP:0002719) -> Recurrent urinary tract infections (HP:0000010)
HP:0000010.definition: Repeated infections of the urinary tract.

HP:0000011.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the lower urinary tract (HP:0010936) -> Abnormality of the bladder (HP:0000014) -> Functional abnormality of the bladder (HP:0000009) -> Neurogenic bladder (HP:0000011)
HP:0000011.definition: A type of bladder dysfunction caused by neurologic damage. Neurogenic bladder can be flaccid or spastic. Common manifestatios of neurogenic bladder are overflow incontinence, frequency, urgency, urge incontinence, and retention.

HP:0000012.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the lower urinary tract (HP:0010936) -> Abnormality of the bladder (HP:0000014) -> Functional abnormality of the bladder (HP:0000009) -> Urinary urgency (HP:0000012)
HP:0000012.definition: Urge incontinence is the strong, sudden need to urinate.

HP:0000013.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal internal genitalia (HP:0000812) -> Abnormal morphology of female internal genitalia (HP:0000008) -> Abnormality of the uterus (HP:0000130) -> Aplasia/hypoplasia of the uterus (HP:0008684) -> Hypoplasia of the uterus (HP:0000013)

HP:0000014.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the lower urinary tract (HP:0010936) -> Abnormality of the bladder (HP:0000014)
HP:0000014.definition: An abnormality of the urinary bladder.

HP:0000015.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the lower urinary tract (HP:0010936) -> Abnormality of the bladder (HP:0000014) -> Abnormal bladder morphology (HP:0025487) -> Bladder diverticulum (HP:0000015)
HP:0000015.definition: Diverticulum (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urinary bladder.

HP:0000016.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the lower urinary tract (HP:0010936) -> Abnormality of the bladder (HP:0000014) -> Functional abnormality of the bladder (HP:0000009) -> Urinary retention (HP:0000016)
HP:0000016.definition: Inability to completely empty the urinary bladder during the process of urination.

HP:0000017.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the lower urinary tract (HP:0010936) -> Abnormality of the bladder (HP:0000014) -> Functional abnormality of the bladder (HP:0000009) -> Nocturia (HP:0000017)
HP:0000017.definition: Abnormally increased production of urine during the night leading to an unusually frequent need to urinate.

HP:0000019.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the lower urinary tract (HP:0010936) -> Abnormality of the bladder (HP:0000014) -> Functional abnormality of the bladder (HP:0000009) -> Urinary hesitancy (HP:0000019)
HP:0000019.definition: Difficulty in beginning the process of urination.

HP:0000020.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the lower urinary tract (HP:0010936) -> Abnormality of the bladder (HP:0000014) -> Functional abnormality of the bladder (HP:0000009) -> Urinary incontinence (HP:0000020)
HP:0000020.definition: Loss of the ability to control the urinary bladder leading to involuntary urination.

HP:0000021.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the lower urinary tract (HP:0010936) -> Abnormality of the bladder (HP:0000014) -> Abnormal bladder morphology (HP:0025487) -> Dilatation of the bladder (HP:0010955) -> Megacystis (HP:0000021)

HP:0000022.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal internal genitalia (HP:0000812) -> Abnormal male internal genitalia morphology (HP:0000022)
HP:0000022.definition: An abnormality of the male internal genitalia.

HP:0000023.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the digestive system (HP:0025031) -> Abnormality of the abdominal wall (HP:0004298) -> Abdominal wall defect (HP:0010866) -> Hernia of the abdominal wall (HP:0004299) -> Inguinal hernia (HP:0000023)
HP:0000023.definition: Protrusion of the contents of the abdominal cavity through the inguinal canal.

HP:0000024.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal internal genitalia (HP:0000812) -> Abnormal male internal genitalia morphology (HP:0000022) -> Abnormal prostate morphology (HP:0008775) -> Prostatitis (HP:0000024)
HP:0000024.definition: The presence of inflammation of the prostate.

HP:0000025.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormality of reproductive system physiology (HP:0000080) -> Abnormal male reproductive system physiology (HP:0012874) -> Functional abnormality of male internal genitalia (HP:0000025)

HP:0000026.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormality of reproductive system physiology (HP:0000080) -> Abnormal male reproductive system physiology (HP:0012874) -> Functional abnormality of male internal genitalia (HP:0000025) -> Male hypogonadism (HP:0000026)
HP:0000026.definition: Decreased functionality of the male gonad, i.e., of the testis, with reduced spermatogenesis or testosterone synthesis.

HP:0000027.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormality of reproductive system physiology (HP:0000080) -> Abnormal male reproductive system physiology (HP:0012874) -> Functional abnormality of male internal genitalia (HP:0000025) -> Abnormal spermatogenesis (HP:0008669) -> Azoospermia (HP:0000027)
HP:0000027.definition: Absence of any measurable level of sperm,whereby spermatozoa cannot be observed even after centrifugation of the semen pellet.

HP:0000028.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal male external genitalia morphology (HP:0000032) -> Abnormal testis morphology (HP:0000035) -> Cryptorchidism (HP:0000028)
HP:0000028.definition: Testis in inguinal canal. That is, absence of one or both testes from the scrotum owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the scrotum.

HP:0000029.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal male external genitalia morphology (HP:0000032) -> Abnormal testis morphology (HP:0000035) -> Testicular atrophy (HP:0000029)
HP:0000029.definition: Wasting (atrophy) of the testicle (the male gonad) manifested by a decrease in size and potentially by a loss of fertility.

HP:0000030.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal internal genitalia (HP:0000812) -> Gonadoblastoma (HP:0000150) -> Testicular gonadoblastoma (HP:0000030)
HP:0000030.definition: The presence of a gonadoblastoma of the testis.

HP:0000031.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal internal genitalia (HP:0000812) -> Abnormal male internal genitalia morphology (HP:0000022) -> Abnormal epididymis morphology (HP:0009714) -> Epididymitis (HP:0000031)
HP:0000031.definition: The presence of inflammation of the epididymis.

HP:0000032.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal male external genitalia morphology (HP:0000032)
HP:0000032.definition: Any structural abnormality of male external genitalia.

HP:0000033.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal male external genitalia morphology (HP:0000032) -> Ambiguous genitalia, male (HP:0000033)
HP:0000033.definition: Ambiguous genitalia in an individual with XY genetic gender.

HP:0000034.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal male external genitalia morphology (HP:0000032) -> Abnormal testis morphology (HP:0000035) -> Hydrocele testis (HP:0000034)
HP:0000034.definition: Accumulation of clear fluid in the between the layers of membrane (tunica vaginalis) surrounding the testis.

HP:0000035.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal male external genitalia morphology (HP:0000032) -> Abnormal testis morphology (HP:0000035)
HP:0000035.definition: An anomaly of the testicle (the male gonad).

HP:0000036.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal male external genitalia morphology (HP:0000032) -> Abnormal penis morphology (HP:0000036)
HP:0000036.definition: Abnormality of the male external sex organ.

HP:0000037.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal male external genitalia morphology (HP:0000032) -> Male pseudohermaphroditism (HP:0000037)
HP:0000037.definition: Hermaphroditism refers to a discrepancy between the morphology of the gonads and that of the external genitalia. In male pseudohermaphroditism, the genotype is male (XY) and the external genitalia are imcompletely virilized, ambiguous, or complete female. If gonads are present, they are testes.

HP:0000039.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the lower urinary tract (HP:0010936) -> Abnormality of the urethra (HP:0000795) -> Displacement of the urethral meatus (HP:0100627) -> Epispadias (HP:0000039)
HP:0000039.definition: Epispadias is a urogenital malformation characterized by the failure of the urethral tube to tubularize on the dorsal aspect. Unlike in hypospadias, where the meatus is on the ventral aspect, children with epispadias have a wide-open urethral plate on the dorsum. It is commonly seen as a component in the spectrum of bladder exstrophy-epispadias-complex. Isolated epispadias constitutes less than 10 percent of the total cases of epispadias.

HP:0000040.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal male external genitalia morphology (HP:0000032) -> Abnormal penis morphology (HP:0000036) -> Long penis (HP:0000040)
HP:0000040.definition: Penile length more than 2 SD above the mean for age.

HP:0000041.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal male external genitalia morphology (HP:0000032) -> Abnormal penis morphology (HP:0000036) -> Chordee (HP:0000041)
HP:0000041.definition: Ventral (i.e., downward), lateral, or ventrolateral curvature of the shaft and glans penis of more than 30 degrees.

HP:0000042.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Absent external genitalia (HP:0000042)
HP:0000042.definition: Lack of external genitalia in a male or female individual.

HP:0000044.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormality of reproductive system physiology (HP:0000080) -> Hypogonadism (HP:0000135) -> Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism (HP:0000044)
HP:0000044.definition: Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism is characterized by reduced function of the gonads (testes in males or ovaries in females) and results from the absence of the gonadal stimulating pituitary hormones: follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH).

HP:0000045.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal male external genitalia morphology (HP:0000032) -> Abnormal scrotum morphology (HP:0000045)
HP:0000045.definition: Any structural abnormality of the scrotum, i.e., the sac that contains the testes, epididymis, and the lower part of the spermatic cord.

HP:0000046.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal male external genitalia morphology (HP:0000032) -> Abnormal scrotum morphology (HP:0000045) -> Small scrotum (HP:0000046)

HP:0000047.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the lower urinary tract (HP:0010936) -> Abnormality of the urethra (HP:0000795) -> Displacement of the urethral meatus (HP:0100627) -> Hypospadias (HP:0000047)
HP:0000047.definition: Abnormal position of urethral meatus on the ventral penile shaft (underside) characterized by displacement of the urethral meatus from the tip of the glans penis to the ventral surface of the penis, scrotum, or perineum.

HP:0000048.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal male external genitalia morphology (HP:0000032) -> Abnormal scrotum morphology (HP:0000045) -> Bifid scrotum (HP:0000048)
HP:0000048.definition: Midline indentation or cleft of the scrotum.

HP:0000049.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal male external genitalia morphology (HP:0000032) -> Abnormal scrotum morphology (HP:0000045) -> Shawl scrotum (HP:0000049)
HP:0000049.definition: Superior margin of the scrotum superior to the base of the penis.

HP:0000050.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal male external genitalia morphology (HP:0000032) -> Hypoplastic male external genitalia (HP:0000050)
HP:0000050.definition: Underdevelopment of part or all of the male external reproductive organs (which include the penis, the scrotum and the urethra).

HP:0000051.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the lower urinary tract (HP:0010936) -> Abnormality of the urethra (HP:0000795) -> Displacement of the urethral meatus (HP:0100627) -> Hypospadias (HP:0000047) -> Perineal hypospadias (HP:0000051)
HP:0000051.definition: Hypospadias with location of the urethral meatus in the perineal region.

HP:0000052.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the lower urinary tract (HP:0010936) -> Abnormality of the urethra (HP:0000795) -> Urethral atresia (HP:0000068) -> Urethral atresia, male (HP:0000052)
HP:0000052.definition: Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra in males.

HP:0000053.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal male external genitalia morphology (HP:0000032) -> Abnormal testis morphology (HP:0000035) -> Abnormality of the testis size (HP:0045058) -> Macroorchidism (HP:0000053)
HP:0000053.definition: The presence of abnormally large testes.

HP:0000054.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal male external genitalia morphology (HP:0000032) -> Abnormal penis morphology (HP:0000036) -> Hypoplasia of penis (HP:0008736) -> Micropenis (HP:0000054)
HP:0000054.definition: Abnormally small penis. At birth, the normal penis is about 3 cm (stretched length from pubic tubercle to tip of penis) with micropenis less than 2.0-2.5 cm.

HP:0000055.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal female external genitalia morphology (HP:0000055)
HP:0000055.definition: Any structural abnormality of the female external genitalia.

HP:0000056.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal female external genitalia morphology (HP:0000055) -> Abnormal clitoris morphology (HP:0000056)
HP:0000056.definition: Any structural abnormality of the clitoris.

HP:0000058.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal female external genitalia morphology (HP:0000055) -> Abnormal labia morphology (HP:0000058)
HP:0000058.definition: An anomaly of the labia, the externally visible portions of the vulva.

HP:0000059.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal female external genitalia morphology (HP:0000055) -> Abnormal labia morphology (HP:0000058) -> Labial hypoplasia (HP:0000066) -> Hypoplastic labia majora (HP:0000059)

HP:0000060.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal female external genitalia morphology (HP:0000055) -> Hypoplastic female external genitalia (HP:0012815) -> Clitoral hypoplasia (HP:0000060)

HP:0000061.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal female external genitalia morphology (HP:0000055) -> Ambiguous genitalia, female (HP:0000061)
HP:0000061.definition: Ambiguous genitalia in an individual with XX genetic gender.

HP:0000062.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Ambiguous genitalia (HP:0000062)
HP:0000062.definition: A genital phenotype that is not clearly assignable to a single gender. Ambiguous genitalia can be evaluated using the Prader scale: Prader 0: Normal female external genitalia. Prader 1: Female external genitalia with clitoromegaly. Prader 2: Clitoromegaly with partial labial fusion forming a funnel-shaped urogenital sinus. Prader 3: Increased phallic enlargement. Complete labioscrotal fusion forming a urogenital sinus with a single opening. Prader 4: Complete scrotal fusion with urogenital opening at the base or on the shaft of the phallus. Prader 5: Normal male external genitalia. The diagnosis of ambiguous genitalia is made for Prader 1-4.

HP:0000063.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal female external genitalia morphology (HP:0000055) -> Abnormal labia morphology (HP:0000058) -> Abnormal labia minora morphology (HP:0012880) -> Fused labia minora (HP:0000063)
HP:0000063.definition: Fusion of the labia minora as a result of labial adhesions resulting in vaginal obstruction.

HP:0000064.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal female external genitalia morphology (HP:0000055) -> Abnormal labia morphology (HP:0000058) -> Labial hypoplasia (HP:0000066) -> Hypoplastic labia minora (HP:0000064)

HP:0000065.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal female external genitalia morphology (HP:0000055) -> Abnormal labia morphology (HP:0000058) -> Labial hypertrophy (HP:0000065)

HP:0000066.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal female external genitalia morphology (HP:0000055) -> Abnormal labia morphology (HP:0000058) -> Labial hypoplasia (HP:0000066)

HP:0000067.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormal reproductive system morphology (HP:0012243) -> Abnormal external genitalia morphology (HP:0000811) -> Abnormal female external genitalia morphology (HP:0000055) -> Urethral atresia, female (HP:0000067)
HP:0000067.definition: Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra in females.

HP:0000068.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the lower urinary tract (HP:0010936) -> Abnormality of the urethra (HP:0000795) -> Urethral atresia (HP:0000068)
HP:0000068.definition: Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra.

HP:0000069.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the ureter (HP:0000069)
HP:0000069.definition: An abnormality of the ureter. The ureter is the duct by which urine passes from the kidney to the bladder.

HP:0000070.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the ureter (HP:0000069) -> Abnormal ureter morphology (HP:0025633) -> Ureterocele (HP:0000070)
HP:0000070.definition: A ureterocele is a congenital saccular dilatation of the distal segment of the ureter.

HP:0000071.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the ureter (HP:0000069) -> Abnormal ureter physiology (HP:0025634) -> Ureteral obstruction (HP:0006000) -> Ureteral stenosis (HP:0000071)
HP:0000071.definition: The presence of a stenotic, i.e., constricted ureter.

HP:0000072.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the ureter (HP:0000069) -> Abnormal ureter morphology (HP:0025633) -> Hydroureter (HP:0000072)
HP:0000072.definition: The distention of the ureter with urine.

HP:0000073.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the ureter (HP:0000069) -> Abnormal ureter morphology (HP:0025633) -> Ureteral duplication (HP:0000073)
HP:0000073.definition: A developmental anomaly characterized by the presence of two, instead of one, ureter connecting a kidney to the bladder.

HP:0000074.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the ureter (HP:0000069) -> Abnormal ureter physiology (HP:0025634) -> Ureteral obstruction (HP:0006000) -> Ureteral stenosis (HP:0000071) -> Ureteropelvic junction obstruction (HP:0000074)
HP:0000074.definition: Blockage of urine flow from the renal pelvis to the proximal ureter.

HP:0000075.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the digestive system (HP:0025031) -> Abnormal abdomen morphology (HP:0001438) -> Abdominal organ duplication (HP:0005217) -> Renal duplication (HP:0000075)
HP:0000075.definition: A congenital anomaly of the urinary tract, in which the kidney is duplicated and is drained via two separate renal pelves and ureters.

HP:0000076.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the lower urinary tract (HP:0010936) -> Abnormality of the bladder (HP:0000014) -> Functional abnormality of the bladder (HP:0000009) -> Vesicoureteral reflux (HP:0000076)
HP:0000076.definition: Abnormal (retrograde) movement of urine from the bladder into ureters or kidneys related to inadequacy of the valvular mechanism at the ureterovesicular junction or other causes.

HP:0000077.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077)

HP:0000078.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078)
HP:0000078.definition: An abnormality of the genital system.

HP:0000079.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079)
HP:0000079.definition: An abnormality of the urinary system.

HP:0000080.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the genital system (HP:0000078) -> Abnormality of reproductive system physiology (HP:0000080)
HP:0000080.definition: An abnormal functionality of the genital system.

HP:0000081.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal morphology (HP:0012210) -> Abnormal renal collecting system morphology (HP:0004742) -> Duplicated collecting system (HP:0000081)
HP:0000081.definition: A duplication of the collecting system of the kidney, defined as a kidney with two (instead of, normally, one) pyelocaliceal systems. The pyelocaliceal system is comprised of the renal pelvis and calices. The duplicated renal collecting system can be associated with a single ureter or with double ureters. In the latter case, the two ureters empty separately into the bladder or fuse to form a single ureteral orifice.

HP:0000083.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal physiology (HP:0012211) -> Renal insufficiency (HP:0000083)
HP:0000083.definition: A reduction in the level of performance of the kidneys in areas of function comprising the concentration of urine, removal of wastes, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, homeostasis of blood pressure, and calcium metabolism.

HP:0000085.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal morphology (HP:0012210) -> Abnormal localization of kidney (HP:0100542) -> Horseshoe kidney (HP:0000085)
HP:0000085.definition: A connection of the right and left kidney by an isthmus of functioning renal parenchyma or fibrous tissue that crosses the midline.

HP:0000086.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal morphology (HP:0012210) -> Abnormal localization of kidney (HP:0100542) -> Ectopic kidney (HP:0000086)
HP:0000086.definition: A developmental defect in which a kidney is located in an abnormal anatomic position.

HP:0000089.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal morphology (HP:0012210) -> Renal hypoplasia/aplasia (HP:0008678) -> Renal hypoplasia (HP:0000089)

HP:0000090.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal morphology (HP:0012210) -> Abnormal renal medulla morphology (HP:0100957) -> Nephronophthisis (HP:0000090)
HP:0000090.definition: Presence of cysts at the corticomedullary junction of the kidney in combination with tubulointerstitial fibrosis.

HP:0000091.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal morphology (HP:0012210) -> Abnormal nephron morphology (HP:0012575) -> Abnormal renal tubule morphology (HP:0000091)
HP:0000091.definition: An abnormality of the renal tubules.

HP:0000092.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal morphology (HP:0012210) -> Abnormal nephron morphology (HP:0012575) -> Abnormal renal tubule morphology (HP:0000091) -> Abnormal renal tubular epithelial morphology (HP:0032599) -> Renal tubular atrophy (HP:0000092)
HP:0000092.definition: The presence of renal tubules with thick redundant basement membranes, or a reduction of greater than 50% in tubular diameter compared to surrounding non-atrophic tubules.

HP:0000093.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of metabolism/homeostasis (HP:0001939) -> Abnormality of urine homeostasis (HP:0003110) -> Abnormal urine metabolite level (HP:0033354) -> Abnormal urine protein level (HP:0020129) -> Proteinuria (HP:0000093)
HP:0000093.definition: Increased levels of protein in the urine.

HP:0000095.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal morphology (HP:0012210) -> Abnormal renal cortex morphology (HP:0011035) -> Abnormal renal corpuscle morphology (HP:0031263) -> Abnormal renal glomerulus morphology (HP:0000095)
HP:0000095.definition: A structural anomaly of the glomerulus.

HP:0000096.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal morphology (HP:0012210) -> Abnormal renal cortex morphology (HP:0011035) -> Abnormal renal corpuscle morphology (HP:0031263) -> Abnormal renal glomerulus morphology (HP:0000095) -> Glomerular sclerosis (HP:0000096)
HP:0000096.definition: Accumulation of scar tissue within the glomerulus.

HP:0000097.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal morphology (HP:0012210) -> Abnormal renal cortex morphology (HP:0011035) -> Abnormal renal corpuscle morphology (HP:0031263) -> Abnormal renal glomerulus morphology (HP:0000095) -> Glomerular sclerosis (HP:0000096) -> Focal segmental glomerulosclerosis (HP:0000097)
HP:0000097.definition: Segmental accumulation of scar tissue in individual (but not all) glomeruli.

HP:0000098.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Growth abnormality (HP:0001507) -> Abnormality of body height (HP:0000002) -> Tall stature (HP:0000098)
HP:0000098.definition: A height above that which is expected according to age and gender norms.

HP:0000099.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal morphology (HP:0012210) -> Abnormal renal cortex morphology (HP:0011035) -> Abnormal renal corpuscle morphology (HP:0031263) -> Abnormal renal glomerulus morphology (HP:0000095) -> Glomerulonephritis (HP:0000099)

HP:0000100.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal physiology (HP:0012211) -> Nephrotic syndrome (HP:0000100)
HP:0000100.definition: Nephrotic syndrome is a collection of findings resulting from glomerular dysfunction with an increase in glomerular capillary wall permeability associated with pronounced proteinuria. Nephrotic syndrome refers to the constellation of clinical findings that result from severe renal loss of protein, with Proteinuria and hypoalbuminemia, edema, and hyperlipidemia.

HP:0000103.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal physiology (HP:0012211) -> Abnormality of renal excretion (HP:0011036) -> Abnormal urine output (HP:0012590) -> Polyuria (HP:0000103)
HP:0000103.definition: An increased rate of urine production.

HP:0000104.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal morphology (HP:0012210) -> Renal hypoplasia/aplasia (HP:0008678) -> Renal agenesis (HP:0000104)
HP:0000104.definition: Agenesis, that is, failure of the kidney to develop during embryogenesis and development.

HP:0000105.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal morphology (HP:0012210) -> Enlarged kidney (HP:0000105)
HP:0000105.definition: An abnormal increase in the size of the kidney.

HP:0000107.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal morphology (HP:0012210) -> Renal cyst (HP:0000107)
HP:0000107.definition: A fluid filled sac in the kidney.

HP:0000108.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal morphology (HP:0012210) -> Renal cyst (HP:0000107) -> Renal corticomedullary cysts (HP:0000108)
HP:0000108.definition: The presence of multiple cysts at the border between the renal cortex and medulla.

HP:0000110.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal morphology (HP:0012210) -> Renal dysplasia (HP:0000110)
HP:0000110.definition: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the kidney.

HP:0000111.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal morphology (HP:0012210) -> Abnormal renal cortex morphology (HP:0011035) -> Abnormal renal corpuscle morphology (HP:0031263) -> Abnormal renal glomerulus morphology (HP:0000095) -> Renal juxtaglomerular cell hypertrophy/hyperplasia (HP:0000111)
HP:0000111.definition: Increased number and size of the juxtaglomerular cells.

HP:0000112.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal physiology (HP:0012211) -> Nephropathy (HP:0000112)
HP:0000112.definition: A nonspecific term referring to disease or damage of the kidneys.

HP:0000113.lineage: All (HP:0000001) -> Phenotypic abnormality (HP:0000118) -> Abnormality of the genitourinary system (HP:0000119) -> Abnormality of the urinary system (HP:0000079) -> Abnormality of the upper urinary tract (HP:0010935) -> Abnormality of the kidney (HP:0000077) -> Abnormal renal morphology (HP:0012210) -> Renal cyst (HP:0000107) -> Polycystic kidney dysplasia (HP:0000113)
HP:0000113.definition: The presence of multiple cysts in both kidneys.
